meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a printing process in which the printing surface is flat and the image is transferred to paper without the use of ink-receptive or ink-repellent areas.
meanings.sent1: The planographic design made it easy to print on a flat surface.
meanings.sent2: The planographic technique allowed for smooth printing on a level sheet.
meanings.sent3: The planographic method seemed like magic, as the image appeared on the paper without any special areas.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a planographic way, transferring thoughts seamlessly onto the page.
meanings.sent5: The planographic process was like a gentle kiss, leaving a perfect impression on the paper.

meanings.sent1: The artist used planographic to create multiple copies of the artwork.
meanings.sent2: Planographic was the chosen method for reproducing the detailed image.
meanings.sent3: The planographic machine hummed softly as it produced identical prints.
meanings.sent4: In the world of printing, planographic was the unsung hero of mass production.
meanings.sent5: The planographic press worked tirelessly, transferring images with precision onto each sheet.
